page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT 2
page.content: employing hundreds in steel fabrication from moulding frames to huge contracts involving steel work for bridges and aerodromes. There is still some commercial fishing for salmon but old habits die hard and there are twenty one small boats used for lobsters,netting herring and mackerel, and line fishing for cod. Creels and lines are still made locally.Some people collect winkles and whelks at a tide line. The whelks and lobsters are sold to a firm in Golspie and are eventually sold in Europe. In the block there are five farms and the average size is 148 acres .The main crops are wheat, oil - seed rape,peas,barley, oats,spring - barley and potatoes.
